questions.text: Low Stationary phase of demographic cycle is:
Demographic bonus is:

options.label: D
options.text: Decrease in population in years due to contraception

questions.correct_answer: D. Decrease in population in years due to contraception
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • – Demographic transition: high BR to low BR
  • • – Demographic dividend/ gift/ decline: excess monitory return (stage III)
  • • – Demographic window: working age group is more
  • • – Demographic Trap- high BR & low DR leading to population explosion (stage II)

questions.text: Survey of 4 cities A, B, C and D reported TFR as 2.1, 2.4, 2.6, and 2.8 respectively. Which city has achieved desirable TFR?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Fertility Indicators
  • • • TFR
  • • – Standardized index for fertility level
  • • – Synthetic/ artificial rate: no counting as this would mean that waiting until women completes child bearing
  • • – Magnitude of completed family size
  • • – Replacement level of fertility, TFR = 2.1
  • • • NRR:
  • • – NRR = 1, each generation of women is exactly reproducing itself
  • • – To achieve NRR = 1: CPR > 60%
  • • – Best indicator of fertility
  • • • GRR/ NRR = 0.5 TFR (approx.)

questions.text: Average number of children that would be born to a female over her reproductive life span refers to:
Registration of births to married couples on state and national level is done by:
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Civil Registration System: Birth & Death Registration Act
  • • Census:
  • • Every 10 years census Census Act, 1948 Registrar General (census commissioner), Ministry of Home Affairs 1st census in 1871 1st disability census was done in 1981 Census of 2021 has been postponed till further notice due to COVID 19 pandemic
  • • Every 10 years census
  • • Census Act, 1948
  • • Registrar General (census commissioner), Ministry of Home Affairs
  • • 1st census in 1871
  • • 1st disability census was done in 1981
  • • Census of 2021 has been postponed till further notice due to COVID 19 pandemic

questions.text: In a population of 10000 the sex ratio is more than 1000. What is the correct option from below?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Sex ratio – Number of females * 1000 Number of males

questions.text: A 16 months old child has weight 8 kg. Look at the chart given below; best management will be:

options.label: A
options.text: Child is healthy, no advice required further

options.label: B
options.text: Child moderately undernourished (MAM), mother given advice

options.label: C
options.text: Child severely malnourished (SAM), mother given advice

options.label: D
options.text: Child severely malnourished (SAM), referral to nutritional rehabilitation centre (NRC)

questions.correct_answer: B. Child moderately undernourished (MAM), mother given advice
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • The growth shows yellow colour, and therefore it is a case of moderate malnutrition

questions.text: An aanganwadi worker takes measurements for weight and height for a child. Height for age in the child is less than – 2SD. It signifies:
Minimum number of ANC visits:
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • ANC Visits
  • • • Ideal Visits (WHO):
  • • • Monthly visits till 7th month (7)
  • • • Bimonthly visit in 8th month (2)
  • • • Weekly visit in 9th month (5)
  • • • Minimum Visits: 4 (India); 8 (WHO)
  • • • 1 early registration (< 12 weeks)
  • • • 2nd visit: 14- 26 weeks
  • • • 3rd visit: 28- 34 weeks
  • • • 4th visit: after 36 weeks

questions.text: Number of maternal deaths due to pregnancy related process expressed per 1 lakh live births is known as:

options.label: D
options.text: Adult lifetime risk of maternal death

questions.text: Which is the home-based pregnancy test kit provided by Government of India?
Patient from Chhattisgarh complaints of Spasticity and pure motor palsy. What history to ask?

options.label: D
options.text: History of similar events in past

questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • VAPP and GBS present with flaccid paralysis

questions.text: Highest content of sodium is found in:
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Cereals have the lowest amount of sodium; canned soup has highest amount of sodium but option C is loaf (not slice) of bread

questions.text: A farmer’s wife ate bajra in meal and developed allergy. The farmer brought the bajra grains to a doctor who noticed black grains mixed in that. How will you separate the adulterant from the food?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Black coloured grains refer to ergot; in 20% salt solution the black particles (ergot seeds) start floating and actual bajra grains will settle down

questions.text: A patient from Bihar presented with generalised bone pain and had excess fluoride intake. He dental examination showed as the image below. Disease of bone in this condition is commonly associated with?

Child was taught hand washing technique which they did in schools. Type of learning
Which is a conditioning factor for Malnutrition – a man- made disease?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Ecological factors of Malnutrition:
  • • i. Food balance sheet
  • • ii. Socio economic factors
  • • iii. Health care services – educational, immunization programs
  • • iv. Conditioning factors – worm infestations, parasitic, bacterial infections

questions.text: A couple brought their son to doctor. They were worried because their son likes to eat foods from multinational companies. What we will call this shift from consumption of traditional natural foods to western fast foods?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Acculturation: cultural contact/ mixing of 2 cultures

In rural areas, patient doesn’t have insurance. But under ESI, registered medical practitioner can give which of the following service to beneficiary?
In Kerala, after flood, people complaining of fever, doxycycline prophylactically was distributed, along with this, which insecticide would be preferred to be distributed?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Zinc phosphide could be hazardous if we do public distribution and sprays (it is toxic) we use it in baits or in small quantities only. for leptospirosis, the best control measure is case detection, treatment and then help stop chain of transmission, prevent human rodent interaction... better sanitation and rodent control.

questions.text: What is the percentage of 1 SD in a normal distribution curve?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • 68%: 1 SD 90%: 1.645 SD 95%: 2 SD 99%: 3 SD
  • • 68%: 1 SD
  • • 90%: 1.645 SD
  • • 95%: 2 SD
  • • 99%: 3 SD

You are a medical officer at a PHC. 50 patient’s requiring anti-hypertensive are being transferred to your PHC from periphery. 40 people need amlodipine (5 mg PO). 10 people have C/ I to use of amlodipine so those people have to be started with lisinopril (10 mg PO). Drugs comes to PHC once a month. How many drugs will you order combined and what will be reorder factor?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • A: 40 * 1 * 30 days = 1200 tablets of amlodipine
  • • B: 10 * 1* 30 days = 300 tablets of lisinopril
  • • Total: 1500
  • • Reorder factor: 2
  • • Total is 1500 * 2 = 3000

questions.text: Mobile medical unit (MMU) consider following statements: i. Government operated fully ii. CAPEX/ Drugs/ Medical supply by government but operations by private iii. Drugs/ medical supplies by government, but services/ CAPEX/ OPEX by private iv. Private funded fully Which of the following is correct combination?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Mobile medical Unit
  • • a. Launched under NHM
  • • b. Vehicle which provides access to inaccessible areas (rural, hilly areas) and marginalised areas
  • • c. 1 MMU/ 10 lakh population
  • • d. Maximum capping of 5 MMU’s/ district
  • • e. Services:
  • • i. Diagnostic – FBS, Urine (routine & microscopy), Hb, Weight & Height, Visual acuity, RDT, Sputum smear collection
  • • ii. Screening > 35 years for DM/ HTN/ Cancer
  • • iii. Dental & eye care (optional)
  • • f. Officer in charge: CDMO
  • • g. Public private partnership (PPP)
  • • i. Finance by government/ CAPEX (Capital expenditure)
  • • ii. OPEX (Operational expenditure) by private
  • • h. Staff: female MBBS MO, ANM, LT, Pharmacist, Driver
  • • i. Cost: 24 lakh/ unit and North east: 28 lakh/ unit

questions.text: A worker working in a cardboard manufacturing firm is at risk of developing:
